intro: Dicerandra christmanii, commonly known as the Christman's dicerandra, is a rare flowering plant native to southern Florida. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands or along the edges of ponds. It is listed as endangered due to habitat loss and is protected under federal law. Dicerandra christmanii plays an important role in its ecosystem, providing nectar for native pollinators.
